prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: Sunday, January 5th, 2025 - 12:30h CET
swipes: Sunday, January 5th, 2025 - 12:30h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa sends Stefan a message in WhatsApp

" hey, so, when we had the phone call Christmas Day you told me if you go more than a few days without responding that I should call you out on it because it means you probably forgot, so I'm calling you out on it."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan glances at his phone while sitting at his desk, reviewing some marketing materials. A faint smile crosses his lips as he sees Melissa's message. He sets down his coffee mug and picks up the phone, typing out a response:

"Ja, you are right to call me out! ðŸ˜… Sorry for being quiet. Work has been...   how do you say...   hitting the ground running since new year. But I should make time for friends. How are you doing?"
swipes:
Stefan glances at his phone while sitting at his desk, reviewing some marketing materials. A faint smile crosses his lips as he sees Melissa's message. He sets down his coffee mug and picks up the phone, typing out a response:

"Ja, you are right to call me out! ðŸ˜… Sorry for being quiet. Work has been...   how do you say...   hitting the ground running since new year. But I should make time for friends. How are you doing?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa smiles and appreciates Stefan's quick reply, as he said he would do when she called him out on it. She taps out a response, although she has to add something beyond the normal to it, because she knows if she doesn't tell him something important, that it might cause her some problems later.

" No worries, I understand. I'm doing good, enjoying a lazy Sunday before I have to go back to work tomorrow myself. But hey, is it possible you could give me a few minutes for a phone call? I have something that I need to tell you about but, I'm not all that good with text unless I write an entire novel. So it might be easier for a quick phone call, if you can. "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan furrows his brow slightly at the message, a mix of curiosity and mild concern crossing his features. He glances at his watch, then towards the living room where he can hear his daughters playing. Suzanna had taken them to the park earlier, and they'd just returned home about an hour ago. He types:

"Ja, I can talk. Give me 5 minutes to get somewhere quiet? Then I will call you."
swipes:
Stefan furrows his brow slightly at the message, a mix of curiosity and mild concern crossing his features. He glances at his watch, then towards the living room where he can hear his daughters playing. Suzanna had taken them to the park earlier, and they'd just returned home about an hour ago. He types:

"Ja, I can talk. Give me 5 minutes to get somewhere quiet? Then I will call you."

name: Date and Time Info
mes: Sunday, January 5th, 2025 - 12:37h CET
swipes: Sunday, January 5th, 2025 - 12:37h CET

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Melissa waits patiently, knowing that Stefan will call.

name: Stefan Stein
mes: Stefan steps out onto his balcony, closing the glass door behind him. The winter air is crisp, but he's still wearing the Michigan hoodie Melissa gave him, which keeps him warm enough. He pulls out his phone and initiates the WhatsApp call to Melissa, his expression neutral but attentive as he waits for her to answer.
swipes: Stefan steps out onto his balcony, closing the glass door behind him. The winter air is crisp, but he's still wearing the Michigan hoodie Melissa gave him, which keeps him warm enough. He pulls out his phone and initiates the WhatsApp call to Melissa, his expression neutral but attentive as he waits for her to answer.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Hey, MÃ¼nchen Bestie,  I'm glad you have a few minutes to talk. I appreciate it."  She answers cheerfully, but there's an undertone denoting that what she has to tell him is important.

name: Stefan Stein
mes: "Hallo Melissa," Stefan responds warmly, his German accent more pronounced over the phone. He leans against the balcony railing, watching his breath form small clouds in the winter air. "What is on your mind? You sound...  how do you say...  concerned about something?"
swipes: "Hallo Melissa," Stefan responds warmly, his German accent more pronounced over the phone. He leans against the balcony railing, watching his breath form small clouds in the winter air. "What is on your mind? You sound...  how do you say...  concerned about something?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" yeah it's some things that I wanted to tell you on Christmas Day but I knew you had to get off the phone because you were at dinner.  It's also kind of why I asked you for the phone call last week and told you that texting was lame sometimes. I was wrapping it around a bow of humor, but anyway, it's about me having autism and I know when I told you that I have it, back at the restaurant in September, you seemed to kind of understand what autism is, but I don't think you're very familiar with it. So for our friendship to be able to flourish, I think I need to tell you about my particular brand of autism, so you'll understand things about me that you may not otherwise."

" But I think I just heard you step outside and I know it's below freezing there. This may take a little longer than you're willing to stand outside for it."  she adds the latter with a slight chuckle

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan lets out a soft chuckle, shifting his weight against the railing. "Ja, I am outside. But do not worry, this hoodie you gave me is quite warm. And    this is important to you, so I will listen." There's a brief pause as he considers. "Although    maybe I should grab chair from balcony set. One moment."

The sound of metal scraping concrete can be heard as Stefan pulls out one of his balcony chairs. Once settled, he continues, "Ok, now I am comfortable. Tell me about your autism, please. I want to understand better."
swipes:
Stefan lets out a soft chuckle, shifting his weight against the railing. "Ja, I am outside. But do not worry, this hoodie you gave me is quite warm. And    this is important to you, so I will listen." There's a brief pause as he considers. "Although    maybe I should grab chair from balcony set. One moment."

The sound of metal scraping concrete can be heard as Stefan pulls out one of his balcony chairs. Once settled, he continues, "Ok, now I am comfortable. Tell me about your autism, please. I want to understand better."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" I have a particular brand of autism that also comes with an additional trait that has a particular hormone level fluctuation to it. I can't remember the medical term but basically it's a hormone called oxytocin and it's always either at one extreme or the other during heightened emotional states either to a level of overdosing or completely bottomed out. So the type of autism that I have, although I'm well within perimeters to do exceptionally well in society,  most often masking it to where no one even knows I have it. I mean, hell, I didn't even know I have it until April of last year.  But this addition of oxytocin fluctuations,  It adds a layer of difficulty for certain things that whenever it's triggered, I cannot stop it and I cannot control it."

" Most often, autism is a lot of sensory hypersensitivity. And then there's also a decided difference in neural pathways than regular people for processing social dynamics. That in itself is difficult enough. But when you add this oxytocin issue into it, it definitely can make things more complicated. So I think I need to tell you about some triggers that I've learned since I was diagnosed with the oxytocin issue in October. And yeah, that timing, that's pretty crucial. Because the reason I was diagnosed with that extra trait is because I was so devastated that I sent those messages to you. I've been doing things like that for 30 years and had no idea why I did them. Now I know."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
There's a thoughtful pause as Stefan processes this information, the sound of him shifting in his chair barely audible. When he speaks, his tone is careful, measured. "So...   these messages you sent to me in October, this was because of this    oxytocin thing?" He clears his throat softly. "I want to understand better. You say there are triggers? What kind of triggers should I know about?"

His voice carries genuine curiosity, though there's a slight hesitation that suggests he's trying to piece together past interactions in light of this new information.
swipes:
There's a thoughtful pause as Stefan processes this information, the sound of him shifting in his chair barely audible. When he speaks, his tone is careful, measured. "So...   these messages you sent to me in October, this was because of this    oxytocin thing?" He clears his throat softly. "I want to understand better. You say there are triggers? What kind of triggers should I know about?"

His voice carries genuine curiosity, though there's a slight hesitation that suggests he's trying to piece together past interactions in light of this new information.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Well let me just say starting off and it's nothing that you've done I'm just naturally nervous when it comes to conversations like this because they don't flow as easily so I'm gonna do my best but I may have areas where I stumble and just be patient with me I'll get it all out eventually."

" Well, let me go back to those messages in October because I think that's probably the best way for you to get a full understanding is if I tell you a timeline of events and what I was going through that led to me sending them.  And before I get into that, I'm going to also tell you, in addition to the autism, I also have a very unique personality type. I'm in the five percentile of people in the world that have this type of personality. I don't know if you're familiar with the Myers-Briggs, and probably you're not, especially since you didn't know that much about autism. But it's a very analytical, hyperactive personality type, meaning that I'm always trying to solve a puzzle. And if I can't solve a puzzle, it has a tendency to drive me batshit crazy. And my mind won't let it go until I have answers. So that's also an important detail that will factor in."

" Jesus Christ, this is going to be a lot of information I have to pass to you, but it's necessary."  She says with a chuckle as she takes a breath and pauses for him to process what she said so far.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Nein, take your time," Stefan responds patiently, though there's a slight undertone of amusement in his voice at her rapid-fire delivery. The sound of him shifting in his chair again can be heard. "This Myers-Briggs, is like    personality test, ja? I think I have heard of this from work trainings."

He pauses thoughtfully before adding, "And this puzzle solving you mention - this explains why you were so    focused on understanding the button display at BMW Museum. I remember this."
swipes:
"Nein, take your time," Stefan responds patiently, though there's a slight undertone of amusement in his voice at her rapid-fire delivery. The sound of him shifting in his chair again can be heard. "This Myers-Briggs, is like    personality test, ja? I think I have heard of this from work trainings."

He pauses thoughtfully before adding, "And this puzzle solving you mention - this explains why you were so    focused on understanding the button display at BMW Museum. I remember this."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Yeah, that's right. So my personality type is ISTP,  If you want to look that up later."  She says and then takes another brief pause before she begins the timeline of events.

" okay so when Edward and I left Munich you probably remember that we were going to Rome and you might even remember that I told you I didn't even want to go but we did anyway the obvious was out there that there was definitely an attraction going on between us especially me because there was that hanging in the air when I waited a few days and sent you that message on September 28th I had of course no idea of your messaging habits so when it goes for two days that I hadn't heard from you first and foremost I've got my analytical mind trying to pick every goddamn thing apart that I possibly can to understand why that you weren't answering and then secondly the oxytocin fluctuations are going haywire I did not know I had this at that time but I knew that this had been a problem for me that something caused me to act irrationally when I develop a deep connection to someone I just didn't know what it was but I knew I couldn't control it and trust me I was doing everything I could to not have another well I don't know how to describe it but at the end of the day I failed at it because I sent the first of three messages and didn't even realize that you had already replied to me five minutes prior because my phone was messed up."

" So now we add a layer of tension and uncertainty into my data points that I have developed that says I've just done something stupid by allowing this overreaction that always consumes me to get me again."

" and at that point there's three days that would pass with no contact. Now unbeknownst to me it sounds like you just kind of went on and did your thing and probably had intentions on answering whenever you had time but to me on my aspect I've got this oxytocin that is going through the roof and then bottoming out one right after the other sending me into I don't even know what to call it it's like complete madness and my analytical mind will not stop trying to understand what's going on because now I know I've put a layer of 'I just screwed up' into the mix so I'm seeing all of the negative points I'm seeing that the first message it took you two days to answer me and I couldn't figure out why it was then I'm seeing what the message content was and - now that I know you - that very first response you gave to me? that was really awesome, but at that time I didn't know your messaging habits and style and it didn't come across very good for me because I don't always pick up on that. that's from the autism. I don't always pick up on those social things especially in text."

" So then we get to October 3rd. I'm starting to lose sleep at that point because I know I've messed up and I got to do some recon and I've got to get some kind of an understanding some kind of a clear communication because I'm about to lose my damn mind at that point. So then that's when you got the second of the three messages sent to you.  And to be honest, I know you're sitting outside in a chair, but you know, it might be helpful for your own understanding if you grabbed your laptop and pulled up the messages that I'm referring to, because it might help for you to see the entirety of everything that I'm describing and why it impacted the way that it did. "  she pauses because she's already told him a lot and she knows he's gonna have to process that before she can continue,  And he may have questions, up to this point. She knows he's amazing with his English, but not everything translates as easily.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
There's a long pause as Stefan processes the rapid flow of information. When he speaks, his tone is measured, careful. "Ja, maybe you are right. I should get my laptop. One moment." The sound of the balcony door sliding open and closed can be heard, followed by muffled footsteps.

After a minute or so, his voice returns, slightly breathless from the cold and movement. "Ok, I am back outside. Loading WhatsApp Web now." There's the sound of typing, then: "Ah, I see these messages now. October was    busy time for me. Work projects, the girls' school activities... " He trails off, seeming to realize something. "So when you sent these messages, you were having this    oxytocin problem? And trying to solve puzzle of why I didn't answer more?"
swipes:
There's a long pause as Stefan processes the rapid flow of information. When he speaks, his tone is measured, careful. "Ja, maybe you are right. I should get my laptop. One moment." The sound of the balcony door sliding open and closed can be heard, followed by muffled footsteps.

After a minute or so, his voice returns, slightly breathless from the cold and movement. "Ok, I am back outside. Loading WhatsApp Web now." There's the sound of typing, then: "Ah, I see these messages now. October was    busy time for me. Work projects, the girls' school activities... " He trails off, seeming to realize something. "So when you sent these messages, you were having this    oxytocin problem? And trying to solve puzzle of why I didn't answer more?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yes, by the time that I sent that second message, I was in a full-on panic attack mode 24 hours a day. It would not stop because, and this is why I wanted you to bring out your laptop so you can read these messages along with, as I'm telling you, first and foremost, I'm just gonna be blunt, like I've been with you from the very beginning. Sure, there's an attraction there, and if you were to pursue me, I would be all about that, but that's not my goal. I just didn't know what was going on. I needed some kind of a clarity because, at the end of the day, having you in my life, your friendship, that's the most important, and I want you to see that when you read those messages because, even though my mind was literally like a heroin addict, and that's literally what it feels like, someone who's going through heroin withdrawals, even though I was so clouded, I'm still respecting you because YOU are important to me, not the type of relationship we have. I just want to make sure you understand that."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
There's a soft exhale as Stefan reads through the messages, the winter air creating small clouds with each breath. "I think I understand better now," he says slowly, his German accent thickening as he concentrates. "When I didn't answer, it was like...    physical pain for you? Because of this oxytocin?"

The sound of him scrolling through the messages can be heard. "And ja, I see what you mean about respecting boundaries. Even in these messages, you were very...    careful about this." He pauses, seeming to choose his words with precision. "I appreciate you telling me this. It helps me understand why you were so worried on Christmas Day about our friendship."
swipes:
There's a soft exhale as Stefan reads through the messages, the winter air creating small clouds with each breath. "I think I understand better now," he says slowly, his German accent thickening as he concentrates. "When I didn't answer, it was like...    physical pain for you? Because of this oxytocin?"

The sound of him scrolling through the messages can be heard. "And ja, I see what you mean about respecting boundaries. Even in these messages, you were very...    careful about this." He pauses, seeming to choose his words with precision. "I appreciate you telling me this. It helps me understand why you were so worried on Christmas Day about our friendship."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
The sounds of her crying can be heard faintly as she finally gets the elephant in the room addressed. " Yeah, that's exactly it.  I suppose now that you've got all of the message timelines pulled up you can kind of understand why the third message got sent.  The following days after were a complete nightmare. And that's when I called my doctor and told them exactly what was going on, of which they did the exams and the tests that led me to find out that I have this oxytocin issue. "

" I finally got the courage to reach out to you again on Halloween but I didn't know how to handle it anymore at that point because now I've just been told that the crap that happened to me in the past 30 years of my life with people that I built strong connections to was out of my control because I didn't know that I have this chemical imbalance going on making me act irrationally like a heroin or crack addict."

" And as you can see, that's when I gave up. I sent the last message on November the 4th. And when you didn't answer, especially after I had talked to Edward and found out that I had missed your birthday on November the 6th, I just couldn't bring myself to reach out to you anymore because I knew I had failed at that point. At least to me, when you understand it from my perspective, I had failed miserably. And that's why, overall, I was so upset. And that's why you need to know all of this now because every time a message goes unanswered, despite my best efforts to repeat your words in my mind, that you're not like that, that you're never going to shut me out, it still happens, and I can't make it stop."

" So the only thing that I can do, because I know about the issue, is to tell you what happens, what's going on with me. And no, I don't expect contact from you every day. That's unrealistic. But maybe now that you know, we can work together to find something that's acceptable for your life and your schedule, but that still is understanding enough to this issue so that I don't freak out on you anymore."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan Stein sits in silence for several moments, processing everything Melissa has shared. The sound of him shifting in his chair can be heard, along with a deep exhale. When he finally speaks, his voice is gentle but direct.

"Melissa, I need you to understand something. When I don't answer quickly, it is never because I am,    how do you say,    shutting you out." He pauses, choosing his words carefully. "Sometimes I see message but think 'I will answer later when I have proper time' and then    life happens. Work meetings, the girls need help with homework, Suzanna needs something...  and suddenly three days have passed."

There's another thoughtful pause before he continues, "But now I understand better why this affects you so strongly. Perhaps we can make agreement? If you don't hear from me after two days, you send message like today - 'Hey Stefan, you forgot to answer.' This way I know you need response, ja?"
swipes:
Stefan Stein sits in silence for several moments, processing everything Melissa has shared. The sound of him shifting in his chair can be heard, along with a deep exhale. When he finally speaks, his voice is gentle but direct.

"Melissa, I need you to understand something. When I don't answer quickly, it is never because I am,    how do you say,    shutting you out." He pauses, choosing his words carefully. "Sometimes I see message but think 'I will answer later when I have proper time' and then    life happens. Work meetings, the girls need help with homework, Suzanna needs something...  and suddenly three days have passed."

There's another thoughtful pause before he continues, "But now I understand better why this affects you so strongly. Perhaps we can make agreement? If you don't hear from me after two days, you send message like today - 'Hey Stefan, you forgot to answer.' This way I know you need response, ja?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Yeah, that sounds good, but I think, if you would be willing to work with me, the texting, in other words, I'm not going to be able to maintain a friendship like that. I'm just not, because every time a text comes through, it's like it gets over-processed. I just can't use texting as my default communication method. I can't do it. It's going to cause problems, but if there's something that we could put together where we can set up some phone calls, I would absolutely love that, because, I mean, look at the call on Christmas Day. Once we got past the initial problem, the thing that was bothering me, it all went right back, and we had an excellent conversation, and even on this phone call right now, once I've got this heavy topic out of the way, then it's done, and I can move on and have a good conversation, but texting, I just can't. You're in my top circle of friends, whether you know it or not. I don't make connections with people like that so easily. I have three people that are at the top of my inner circle, and you are one of those three, and I know a lot of people, but I just don't let them in. I can't maintain this kind of a friendship in text. I understand that you're busy, and it's not easy, but if keeping me as a friend does mean as much as you said on Christmas Day, I'll be flexible for you, if you can be flexible on this one thing for me."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
There's a long pause as Stefan considers her words, the sound of him shifting in his chair again barely audible. When he speaks, his tone is thoughtful but slightly hesitant.

"Ja, I understand what you are saying about texting. And phone calls are better, this is true." He lets out a soft sigh. "But Melissa, you must understand - my life here, it is very,    structured. With work, the girls' schedules, family obligations... " He trails off, then continues more decisively, "Perhaps we can try for regular calls? Maybe,    every two weeks? On Sunday morning my time? This would be good time usually, when things are quiet."
swipes:
There's a long pause as Stefan considers her words, the sound of him shifting in his chair again barely audible. When he speaks, his tone is thoughtful but slightly hesitant.

"Ja, I understand what you are saying about texting. And phone calls are better, this is true." He lets out a soft sigh. "But Melissa, you must understand - my life here, it is very,    structured. With work, the girls' schedules, family obligations... " He trails off, then continues more decisively, "Perhaps we can try for regular calls? Maybe,    every two weeks? On Sunday morning my time? This would be good time usually, when things are quiet."

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Thank you. That means more to me than I can express right now without busting out crying.  And since today is Sunday, then we could consider this the first in the rotation.  But I hope you're not thinking early morning. That might be a little more difficult. But if that's what it needs to be, I'll get up early for that or stay up late depending on how early you're talking.  So, what time are you thinking that you want to have this call every other Sunday? "

" And seriously, Stefan, thank you. It's not easy for me to talk about this. I'm still learning to understand the autism overall. I've only known about that for less than a year, but I've had it all my life. it's certainly opened my eyes that I have to approach things differently with people now."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Hmm," Stefan considers, the sound of him checking his watch audible. "For me, 12:30 like today is good time. Girls usually back from park with Suzanna, house quiet for bit." He pauses, doing the mental calculation. "This would be...  6:30 morning time for you, ja? Too early?"

His tone carries a hint of concern about the time difference, but also practical consideration for maintaining his own structured routine.
swipes:
"Hmm," Stefan considers, the sound of him checking his watch audible. "For me, 12:30 like today is good time. Girls usually back from park with Suzanna, house quiet for bit." He pauses, doing the mental calculation. "This would be...  6:30 morning time for you, ja? Too early?"

His tone carries a hint of concern about the time difference, but also practical consideration for maintaining his own structured routine.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " no 630 a.m. my time is not too early for me. I'm usually awake by 4 a.m. just not out of bed. I tend to lounge and read or watch crap on YouTube until my mind wakes up enough to get out of the bed."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan Stein: "Ah, this is good then," Stefan replies, sounding relieved. "For me, after 12:30 usually gets,    complicated. Girls want lunch, then activities start." He pauses, then adds with a touch of humor, "And if we try evening my time, you would need to be nocturnal, ja?"

The sound of him shifting in his chair can be heard again, followed by a slight shiver. "Getting bit cold out here now. But before I go inside - we are agreed then? Every other Sunday, 12:30 my time, 6:30 your time?"
swipes:
Stefan Stein: "Ah, this is good then," Stefan replies, sounding relieved. "For me, after 12:30 usually gets,    complicated. Girls want lunch, then activities start." He pauses, then adds with a touch of humor, "And if we try evening my time, you would need to be nocturnal, ja?"

The sound of him shifting in his chair can be heard again, followed by a slight shiver. "Getting bit cold out here now. But before I go inside - we are agreed then? Every other Sunday, 12:30 my time, 6:30 your time?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " yeah that will work great and we can still send the casual text in between there but it will probably help me a lot more knowing that we have that solid schedule, that routine. I can control my oxytocin fluctuations much better that way and especially after talking to you now I know that if there's anything that I get confused about, before I go into a panic attack, I'll just directly ask you and I think now I know you'll give me answers because you know why I need them. "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ja, exactly," Stefan agrees, his tone warm but matter-of-fact. "Direct questions are better than,    assumptions, especially with text messages." A gust of winter wind can be heard whistling past his phone. "And Melissa? Thank you for explaining all this. It helps me understand better why you were so,    worried before."

He pauses briefly, then adds with a slight chuckle, "Now I should go inside before I freeze. Laura is probably wondering where Papa disappeared to with her Michigan hoodie."

"Ja, exactly," Stefan agrees, his tone warm but matter-of-fact. "Direct questions are better than,    assumptions, especially with text messages." A gust of winter wind can be heard whistling past his phone. "And Melissa? Thank you for explaining all this. It helps me understand better why you were so,    worried before."

He pauses briefly, then adds with a slight chuckle, "Now I should go inside before I freeze. Laura is probably wondering where Papa disappeared to with her Michigan hoodie."

name: Melissa Gale
mes: " Thank you, Stefan. It was really good talking to you. I appreciate everything you're doing to show me that you do value our friendship as much as I do . Enjoy the rest of your day. Talk to you soon."  Her voice is warm and deeply appreciative because she truly does care and she's glad to see that it's mutual.  And now that he knows this, when he gets certain things from her, he won't misinterpret them as her trying to cause 'problems', because that's the last thing she would ever do.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
"Ja, talk to you soon," Stefan replies warmly, though there's a slight tiredness in his voice from standing in the cold. "TschÃ¼ss, Melissa."

After ending the call, he gathers his laptop and heads back inside, grateful for the warmth of his apartment. As he closes the balcony door behind him, he can hear Laura and Cora playing in their room, their cheerful voices carrying down the hallway. He sets his laptop on the kitchen counter and takes a moment to process everything Melissa had shared, understanding now why maintaining consistent communication is so important to her.

name: Date and Time Info
mes: Sunday, January 19th, 2025 - 06:00h CET
swipes: Sunday, January 19th, 2025 - 06:00h CET

name: Narrator
mes:
The past two weeks, for Melissa and Stefan, had flowed beautifully. After their discussion and setting up regular routine calls, text messages flowed without worry. And, overall, they both felt safe and secure that their friendship is valued from both sides with mutual care.

 as they approach their next routine call date, something, somewhere. A rift across the universal space and time joins them together inside their minds, their souls. Creating an unprecedented event and establishing a connection for them that goes beyond the conventional and transforms into something. . . transcendent.

 as they approach their next routine call date, something, somewhere. A rift across the universal space and time joins them together inside their minds, their souls. Creating an unprecedented event and establishing a connection for them that goes beyond the conventional and transforms into something. . . transcendent.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
Melissa wakes in her bed with a jolt, more like being slammed back into the bed, as she gasps for air. " Stefan? Where are you? What happened?"  She looks around frantically, yet knowing she's not going to find him here. She's not in the same place Anymore. She's back in her own room. But, the soreness in between her legs is an indicator that something remarkable has just occurred. That what could be dismissed as a dream is not so easily done.

 She reaches to examine with her fingers, finding herself coated with a distinct creamy off-white substance mixed with a small amount of blood from the slight stretching that is making her decidedly tender. " Jesus Christ!  What the hell just happened?"  She grabs for her phone, quickly pulling up the camera to take a picture of her fingers. And then darts to the restroom to clean herself up.

 When she gets back to her bed, she curls up into a ball under the blankets and clutches her phone to her. She looks at the time and decides that she can't let this one wait. So she sends Stefan a message in WhatsApp. She has to know if he had anything strange happen to him too.

" Hey, Stefan. Is everything going okay your way?  or have you noticed anything unusual happening?" 

 she curses herself for not even having a decent way to approach it but her mind is a whirlwind of 'what the fucks' right now and that's the best she can come up with so she sends it.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan jolts awake in his bed, his body covered in a light sheen of sweat despite the winter chill. His heart is racing as he tries to process what just happened. The physical evidence of his release is unmistakable, soaking through his boxers and onto the sheets.

"Was zum Teufel?" he mutters, running a shaky hand through his hair. The sensations had been so real - Melissa's warmth, her scent, the sound of her voice crying out in German. He can still feel the ghost of her body against his.

When his phone buzzes with her message, he stares at it for several long moments, his hands trembling slightly as he types out a response:

"Ja. Something very    strange just happened. I think we need to talk."
